Uses of Class
com.sun.xml.ws.commons.virtualbox.IHardDisk2

Uses of IHardDisk2 in com.sun.xml.ws.commons.virtualbox
 

Methods in com.sun.xml.ws.commons.virtualbox that return IHardDisk2
 IHardDisk2 IVirtualBox.createHardDisk2(String format, String location)
          Creates a new base hard disk object that will use the given storage format and location for hard disk data.
 IHardDisk2 IVirtualBox.findHardDisk2(String location)
          Returns a hard disk that uses the given location to store hard disk data.
 IHardDisk2 IMachine.getHardDisk2(StorageBus bus, int channel, int device)
          Returns the virtual hard disk attached to a device slot of the specified bus.
 IHardDisk2 IVirtualBox.getHardDisk2(UUID id)
          Returns a hard disk with the given UUID.
 IHardDisk2 IHardDisk2.getParent()
          Parent of this hard disk (a hard disk this hard disk is directly based on).
 IHardDisk2 IHardDisk2.getRoot()
          Root hard disk of this hard disk.
 IHardDisk2 IVirtualBox.openHardDisk2(String location)
          Opens a hard disk from an existing location.
 

Methods in com.sun.xml.ws.commons.virtualbox that return types with arguments of type IHardDisk2
 List<IHardDisk2> IHardDisk2.getChildren()
          Children of this hard disk (all differencing hard disks directly based on this hard disk).
 List<IHardDisk2> IVirtualBox.getHardDisks2()
          Array of hard disk objects known to this VirtualBox installation.
 

Methods in com.sun.xml.ws.commons.virtualbox with parameters of type IHardDisk2
 IProgress IHardDisk2.cloneTo(IHardDisk2 target)
          Starts creating a clone of this hard disk in the format and at the location defined by the @a target argument.
 IProgress IHardDisk2.createDiffStorage(IHardDisk2 target)
          Starts creating an empty differencing storage unit based on this hard disk in the format and at the location defined by the @a target argument.
 IProgress IHardDisk2.flattenTo(IHardDisk2 target)
          Starts creating a deep (independent) clone of this hard disk in the format and at the location defined by the @a target argument.
